subject: Business
title: Setting Your Walk-Away Point
description: A quick, practical guide to Setting Your Walk-Away Point.

hook.text: You told yourself you'd leave at $300K. Then they offered $290K with perks. Your resolve crumbled.

buildup.text: A walk-away point is your hard limit â€” the worst deal you'll accept before choosing your BATNA.

discovery.text: Write it down before the negotiation starts. Emotional pressure in the room distorts your judgment.

twist.text: Without a preset limit, you'll rationalize a bad deal in the moment. 'Close enough' costs real money.

climax.text: The walk-away point also protects you from sunk cost: you've invested time, but a bad deal is still bad.

punchline.text: Decide your limit when you're calm. Enforce it when you're not.

quiz.question: Why should you set a walk-away point before negotiating?
options: Emotions in the room distort your ability to evaluate the deal
It makes you appear more professional
It speeds up the negotiation process
